text: Perry County is a county of the U.S. state of Arkansas. As of the 2020 census, the population was 10,019. The county seat is Perryville. Perry County was founded on December 18, 1840, and named for Commodore Oliver Hazard Perry, naval hero in the War of 1812. == References == Category:1840 establishments in Arkansas Category:Arkansas counties
title: Perry County, Arkansas
